intro: Pentadesma exelliana, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and herbal practices.
